subject: Gardening
title: Findhorn: The Miracle Garden
description: A quick, practical guide to Findhorn: The Miracle Garden.

hook.text: In 1962, three people grew 40-pound cabbages on a Scottish sand dune. Soil experts couldn't explain it.

buildup.text: Peter and Eileen Caddy, plus Dorothy Maclean, founded a garden on barren sand at Findhorn caravan park.

discovery.text: Despite near-zero nutrients, their vegetables grew to extraordinary size, baffling visiting agronomists.

twist.text: The founders claimed they communicated with plant spiritsâ€”'devas'â€”who guided their gardening decisions.

climax.text: Whether miracle or method, Findhorn became a spiritual community of 400 and a model for ecological living.

punchline.text: A sand dune garden started a global eco-movement.

quiz.question: What was remarkable about the Findhorn garden?
options: It grew in a tropical climate using only cold-weather plants
Vegetables grew to extraordinary size on barren sand dunes that experts couldn't explain
It was the first fully automated garden using 1960s computing
